Body: Description: Initiated situation: A Samsung Galaxy S23 smartphone is connected to a computer. Description "SmartPhone (USB Sync)" device type: SmartPhones connected through USB --> see screenshot "EP_smartphone_description_list_of_device_types.jpg" attached. Behavior of the Samsung device: According to the definition under List of Device Types, the Samsung smartphone should be recognized as a “smartphone” device type. In this case, however, it is recognized as 3 different device types, but not as a smartphone: - Windows Portable Device (Media Transfer Protocol) - Teensy Board - USB Modem VID: 4E8 PID: 6860 SN: R5CW50QJK2H --> see screenshot "EP_Devices_R5CW50QJK2H.jpg" attached. Questions: 1. Is this behavior as designed from vendor side? 2. If not, why is the Galaxy S23 smartphone not recognized as a "SmartPhone (USB Sync)" device type? Please check and give feedback. Thank you.
What We've Learned Updated: Asked if a phone is ussually seen as multiple devices.
Next Steps Updated: CInfirmed this is expected.

What We've Learned Updated: Asked if a phone is ussually seen as multiple devices.

24 April
- customer raised new queries regarding the mentioned issue
